data.title: New Zealand citizen stripped of phone, tablet, laptop and hard drive at New Zealand customs after returning from a talk in London about Edward Snowden's released documents.
Air strike kills 15 civilians in Yemen by mistake: Fifteen people on their way to a wedding in Yemen were killed in an air strike after their party was mistaken for an al Qaeda convoy
Pope attacks mega-salaries and big bonuses, saying that they are symptoms of an economy based on greed and inequality.
Uncle of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un executed after being purged for corruption - state news agency

Saudi Arabia's Grand Mufti, the highest religious authority in the country, has condemned suicide bombings as grave crimes, reiterating his stance in unusually strong language. Refers to the attacks as a sin, with attackers condemned to hell.
Pirate Bay Founder Held in Solitary Confinement Without a Warrant as Political Prisoner
Icelandic bank bosses jailed - also made to pay legal costs for the case which amounts to millions of pounds.
Taxpayers to pay for fracking pollution if companies go bust
Missing American in Iran was working for CIA. Family paid $2.5 million to keep quiet.
Edward Snowden named the top Global Thinker of 2013, cautions leaders that mass surveillance opposed most strongly by the young with "lifetimes of votes ahead of them."
